environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Meylan WM, Howard PH; J Pharm Sci 84: 83-92 (1995) (2) Meylan WM et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 18: 664-72 (1999) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 5 was calculated for Randox(SRC), using an estimated log Kow of 1.79(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low.

environmental_biodegradations.References: Weed Science Society of America. Herbicide Handbook. 4th ed. Champaign, IL: Weed Science Society of America, 1979. of America, 1979., p. 94
environmental_biodegradations.Value: MICROBIAL BREAKDOWN /IS/ RESPONSIBLE FOR MAJOR DECOMP.
AEROBIC: Randox degraded to innocuous levels in soil in 3 months using 8 California soils treated with concentrations of Randox ranging from 2.5 to 160 ppm(1).

mechanism_of_action.References: Hartley, D. and H. Kidd (eds.). The Agrochemicals Handbook. Old Woking, Surrey, United Kingdom: Royal Society of Chemistry/Unwin Brothers Ltd., 1983., p. A009/0ct 83
White-Stevens, R. (ed.). Pesticides in the Environment: Volume 1, Part 1, Part 2. New York: Marcel Dekker, Inc., 1971., p. 48
mechanism_of_action.Value: ...AMIDE HERBICIDES INHIBIT PHOTOLYSIS OF WATER (HILL REACTION). /AMIDE HERBICIDES/

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Szeto SY, Price PM; J Agric Food Chem 39: 1679-84 (1991)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: In 1989, Randox was not detected in soil on 12 farms in the Fraser Valley, British Columbia(1).

soil_absorption_mobility.References: Weed Science Society of America. Herbicide Handbook. 4th ed. Champaign, IL: Weed Science Society of America, 1979. of America, 1979., p. 94
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: ADSORPTION /IN BASIC SOIL IS/ DIRECTLY PROP TO COLLOID CONTENT OF SOIL.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: Hartley, D. and H. Kidd (eds.). The Agrochemicals Handbook. Old Woking, Surrey, United Kingdom: Royal Society of Chemistry/Unwin Brothers Ltd., 1983., p. A009/Oct 83
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Duration of /chemical/ activity 3-6 weeks, depending on soil.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc for Randox can be estimated to be 230(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that Randox is expected to have moderate mobility in soil.
